meanings.definition: To form a circle or circuit.
meanings.sent1: The children circuited around the tree during their game.
meanings.sent2: The electrician circuited the wires to create a closed loop.
meanings.sent3: The ants circuited around the fallen crumb, trying to decide who would carry it back to the nest.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts circuited endlessly, like a carousel spinning in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The dancers circuited gracefully around the stage, mesmerizing the audience.

meanings.definition: To make a circuit or circuits.
meanings.sent1: The robot circuited through the maze, following the programmed path.
meanings.sent2: The current circuited through the system, powering up the entire machine.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel circuited around the yard, looking for the perfect spot to bury its acorn.
meanings.sent4: His words circuited through the room, sparking discussions among the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The water circuited smoothly through the pipes, reaching every corner of the house.

meanings.definition: To connect or establish a circuit.
meanings.sent1: She circuited the components carefully to ensure a secure connection.
meanings.sent2: The engineer circuited the new device, testing each link for functionality.
meanings.sent3: The detective circuited the evidence, piecing together the clues of the crime.
meanings.sent4: His smile circuited a warm feeling through her heart, brightening her day.
meanings.sent5: The artist circuited the colors on the canvas, creating a vibrant masterpiece.
